title: Patient in Distress Alert System (PDAS)
text:
Tip



What you‚Äôll find on this page:
An overview of our AI-powered patient-monitoring platform, team credits, and supervision.



Project Overview
The Patient in Distress Alert System (PDAS), built in collaboration with DataStax, addresses critical gaps in patient monitoring:



Fig. 1. Live PDAS dashboard: gesture, speech & inactivity detectors in action.



Help Gestures
Detects three distinct ‚Äúhelp‚Äù gestures via on-device AI.
Multilingual Speech Recognition
Recognises ‚ÄúHELP!‚Äù in English, Mandarin (ÊïëÂëΩ!), and Malay (Tolong!).
Inactivity Detection
Flags patients who remain static beyond safe thresholds.


üí° This AI model runs entirely within the app, ensuring fast, private detection.



Key Features

User Management

Role-based logins for caregivers, patients, and admins.

Patient-Caregiver Matching

Intelligent pairing to streamline assignments.

Alert Management

Real-time alert capture and push notifications.


Our goal is high accuracy in detecting patient needs, so caregivers can respond faster and more confidently.


Team & Supervision



Team Members

Tang Cheng Yin

Lucas Tan Lok Yue

Gigi Wong Qi Hui





Supervisor
Mr Ho Chee Wai
Senior Lecturer, School of Information Systems
Singapore Institute of Technology
